It makes sense what you said about part 2, letting nourishment give boosts to survival/adventure. For example, players start with 1 less heart and less natural regen, but can gain a permanent heart from trying every food. Having a balanced diet gives 10 minutes of 2 bonus hearts and normal natural regen.
Was just about to suggest this!
Same here
In addition to this idea, fishes should dart away if you approach them rapidly. This will discourage simply rushing into them to get their proper loot. Pufferfish would obviously be an exception.

HI THERE FELLOW MINECRAFTER!!!! I was actually just about to post a similar idea to this - based ironically on a datapack. It's different enough I'll put it in it's own post though. https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/community/posts/360068082031-Realistic-Lure-Enchantment
I agree, I think a fish getting on the hook underwater will be cool to see since the water is clear

Right, but how would you get lava/obsidian in a superflat world with no structures?

If you use a lighting rod and a pig is struck (in the overworld), the pig will turn into a zombified piglin, which can not be bartered with.
or maybe you could have pigs struck by lightning become piglin and not zombie piglin, giving you a few moments to barter with them, to get obsidian, to go to the nether

I thought about that, and that won't happen in the over-world. Pig struck by lightning in the over-world automatically turn into zombified piglin (no trading). If you sneak a piglin into the over-world he will only have fifteen seconds before turning zombified, which you can barter in those fifteen seconds, But you still don't have access to the nether in the first place without lava or obsidian to sneak them in.

I also play Minecraft Superflat survival with no structures; and I’m here to advocate that the lack of many resources is part of the fun. Access to the Nether or End would quickly complicate what could be done in the superflat, with loads of unnecessary new decorations. In addition, this would make the acquisition of iron and light sources easier. While I can see why my peers would want this, and it is obvious to me that, per the above system, obsidian would be off-limits before villager acquisition, the crux of of issue that I see is superflat becoming too similar to normal survival.
or make villagers trade obsidian (maybe their last trade or something)
Yeah this should be added
But I want an update which will add a lot of cool items :( This is cool, but first I want a different update.

It cuts the fuse so it can't ignite, I think it's a good idea, but it should be a world option, like fire spreads, daylight cycle etc.

Мне нравится эта идея. Можно добавить также дополнительных мобов, пиратов моряков и тому подобное.
Same slot maybe could be used to equip backpack or similar ._.
I think it's a good idea but you could immediately grab it of your back and fight.       I voted!

I think you should be able to carry multiple things on your back. Above the off hand slot there would be three more slots for your back, players can put swords, shields, axes, pickaxes, shovels, hoes, bows, crossbows, maces, and tridents in these slots. If players choose a sword, shield, and trident for these sheath slots than the player would be walking around with a sword at a angle on his back, the trident at the opposite angle, and the shield straight and slightly in front of the other items exactly how warriors would have carried these weapons (assuming they're carrying them on their back and not their hip, which wouldn't work for Minecraft). Weapons like swords, axes, pickaxes, shovels, hoes, and maces would have the handle pointing up. Items like tridents, bows, crossbows, and shields would have their ends pointing up. When you have three weapons sheathed and non of them are shields than one of the weapons would go straight up, whichever one works best for that situation.

Uses:

1. It would look so extremely cool that everyone would do it even if it was inconvenient. If that's not a use I don't know what is.

I've run out of space for this comment, so I'm going to make a separate post for it, please check it out! :)

Yes please! I was about to post something similar (thought maybe not quite as detailed). I started playing the other day so I could maybe play with the kids a little, but without them, I would have been totally lost. Oh, there goes my sword, what the hell am I supposed to do now!
Yes I would love it because on the xbox 360 version of minecraft there is a tutorial mode and the map is very cool but on the Nintendo switch (and others) there isn't anything
Please I miss the tutorial worlds and would love to play it on my IOS device.

I've played Bedrock and Java for years, and one of the things from Console Edition that I miss the most is the Tutorial. I think that if tutorials are added, there should be an option for you to choose between the classic tu 12 tutorial world, and the tu 46 world, with some added features, because the game has changed so much over the years. I first owned Minecraft for the Xbox 360 (when it was tu 12), and I didn't update it, so when I first saw the tu 46 tutorial world on my cousins Xbox One, I was shocked/stunned, because it was truly incredible. Plus, a tutorial world would be great for new players, it sure helped me and many others when we got the game for the first time.

Yes I need this! I tried Minecraft many years ago for a little while just to use creative mode and then left it. I've bought it again recently for my PC and am really struggling to know what to do now that I'm playing in a survival realm with other friends. Whilst they give me help here and there, It is frustrating not being able to progress on my own.

I would be glad to explain in detail the difficulties I have had with what would seem like fairly simple tasks. The help pages give instructions that don't actually work. YouTubes are great, but sometimes skip a critical detail.
I want them to hire 4J studios to create the tutorial, they already had a tutorial but only on certain versions. They were amazing. Mojang please add this back

On legacy edition, there were new tutorial worlds for every update. It was one of my favorite things about every update because then you could explore the world and see everything that the update added.
i agree
Sounds good man. :) i hope they anmounce this one day. :)

For me the cool down should be always on, because without you can spam, and everything is based on how fast you can click, and many can use special clicks, which are unfair. Doing so, you are bringing back combos in 1.8 combat. This suggestion doesn't bring strategy, because everyone would use tridents and Netherite swords, because they can spam click them.
Are there any ways we could incorporate blocks into this strategy?

Gardening is my favorite thing in minecraft and I would love to see this.

@SteadyRide

Thank you, I’m glad you like the idea, I just wish there were more flower types too, imagine if there was like one new flower every update, The gardens a player could make...

Agreed

An OG cape is not a bad idea.

Other games have done it before, like Runescape for instance.
im a OG Minecraft player and i would love a specialized cape for all us OG players
Does OG mean old gamer?

I was just thinking about an idea like this specifically for the 10 year anniversary for the game. The game has been out for so long, it would be awesome to allow the player's who have been here since the beginning to be rewarded with an awesome cape.

 

I think four different capes would be cool. One for people who purchased during indev, infdev, alpha, and beta respectively. If four is too much, then one veteran cape would be awesome to have
Maybe also a cape for any user who has had an account for 5 years.
Yes, just yes
Capes

I believe that this would be a great idea. I have been playing Minecraft for a very long time (since 1.5). I feel this would show some respect for those who have owned the game before the transition to Microsoft, and to show that they still are playing today. 

My Idea to add to this is that yes a cape should be given to players who have played from 2009 - 2012, BUT they also should have played recently in 2019 - 2020 as well, to show they are still a Dedicated Player / Veteran. 

Thank you for reviewing this idea, and keep up the good work Microsoft!
Agreed, Like a service medal

This is a great idea!
Though now that capes are going to be in the mainstream anyway, with the addition of Migration capes, why should newer players be left out?
I say all players should get a cape that expresses when they originally made their account! That way, there will be much less looking at the same exact cape on everyone's backs.
Maybe these OG capes should reflect what year it was when a given player originally made their account? That way, a new cape could be made every year, and no one would be left out, while the true OG capes are still special to those that have them!

Or maybe people (like me) who had known Minecraft for many years, but only made an account recently. Which wouldn't leave out people who may not have had Minecraft during those times, but knew about it.
T       B.      I

I agree completely! I've been working hard on 4d skins of some of my favorite characters from other games. (one being a Lynel from Zelda's BotW) But now they are useless. I loved walking around as a centaur with a lion head!

The fact that they took them away again because of people being able to shrink their skins to gain an unfair pvp advantage is outrageous only because its already handled with on public servers. they can make it so you can only use the Steve model. I've has this done to me. My skin didn't work on the server. It showed up as a blank Steve skin. So in short, the problem doesn't exist! Servers are already able to disable custom 4d skins. As you said, We should be allowed to use them on our privet worlds and servers at the very least.

I do hope they figure out a way to allow 4d skins again.
I think they should stay in servers, but, you can enable/disable them on singleplayer, local multiplayer and Realms. So I agree with half of this but I will still vote for it.
How can you even create a 4d skin? its currently impossible to render any 4d shape stationary so the skin would constantly be morphing around you to give the illusion of 4d
I would appreciate 4d skins as well people.
By the way time is not the fourth dimension, trength and the W axis is the fourth dimension

This can be made with the shield and can knock off many enemies, this can be useful in closed areas but needs some timing to perform the parry, this also consume durability for each enemy succesfully knocked.
okay but do they get up again?
Imagine if u accidentally knocked ur dog over? imagine if it didn't get up and u needed it to kill a skeleton when u were at 1 heart?

I think there should be a feature to the shield where mobs smaller than a villager will be knocked over instantly. if you are moving with ur shield guarding u and ur  foe hits it then they will have a 50% chance of knocking over, this could be very useful when facing a ravager since the ravager is so square, has short legs and is supposedly heavy, it will have a harder time getting back up and it will be very vulnerable. Mobs that are the size of villagers, zombies, or wither skeletons should have a cooldown of 2 seconds before getting back up. Mobs like ravagers that are super bulky (including iron golems) should have a harder time getting up because of their weight and maybe 5 seconds before they get up. Flying mobs like phantoms and withers should fall on their back if they melee attack and at least 3 seconds before they get up because they are pretty big mobs. wolves should fall over for maybe 1 second because dogs in real life get up very fast when frightened when they are laying down. Slimes should be different because they are slimes, I think that they should have a 50% chance of sticking to ur shield and a 50% chance of bouncing off without damage taken at all. Physics in Minecraft would look very cool and add a lot more pizzazz to Minecraft.

The question is: What worthwhile, new addition would they bring to the sandbox? They are too big to just be an ambient mob after all. As a farm animal, they seem like they would just be semi-aquatic sheep, so that wouldn't work either.
Maybe some mob could be scared of them, like how creepers are scared of cats? Drowned, maybe?
